articles.title: Charles Hoskinson doubts CLARITY Act timeline, says Trump crypto czar should quit
articles.description: Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson said the CLARITY Act may not pass this quarter, and criticized US crypto laws for favoring big banks over innovation.

articles.title: Bank of Italy models Ethereum risks if ETH value collapsed
articles.description: The Bank of Italy modeled the extreme scenario of Ether going to zero to show how market risk in Ethereum’s native token could turn into infrastructure and financial stability risks.

articles.title: Standard Chartered said to plan crypto brokerage, trims ETH forecast
articles.description: Standard Chartered is reportedly developing a crypto prime brokerage platform as traditional banks expand digital asset services.

articles.title: Standard Chartered says ‘2026 will be the year of Ethereum’ as bank backs ETH outperformance
articles.description: Standard Chartered forecasts Ethereum outperformance versus Bitcoin, citing network effects and growing real-world asset adoption.

articles.title: XRP stays pinned near $2.05 as the range tightens into a make-or-break zone
articles.description: The market remains level-driven, with potential for a breakout if $2.08 is reclaimed or a breakdown if $2.04 is breached.

articles.title: Morning Minute: a16z Raises $15B, Targets AI &#038; Crypto
articles.description: a16z raised over 18% of all venture capital in 2025 with a goal of "giving everybody a shot." What does that mean exactly?

articles.title: Strategy makes largest bitcoin purchase since July, adds 13,627 BTC
articles.description: Strategy purchased 13,267 BTC for $1.25 billion via the use of common stock and it's perpetual preferred equity STRC.

articles.title: ‘Big orange’: Michael Saylor’s Strategy buys another 13,627 bitcoin for $1.25 billion following MSCI indexing decision
articles.description: Strategy's holdings account for more than 3% of the total 21 million bitcoin supply — worth around $62 billion.

articles.title: Standard Chartered prepares crypto prime brokerage push: Bloomberg
articles.description: Standard Chartered is reportedly preparing a crypto prime brokerage business to be housed within its SC Ventures unit.

articles.title: VelaFi raises $20 million in Series B to expand stablecoin payments infrastructure
articles.description: The LatAm-based company said the funding will support expansion across the U.S. and Asia.

articles.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
articles.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

articles.title: Tether freezes $182 million in USDT stablecoin across five Tron blockchain wallets
articles.description: The freezes were part of Tether's policy to comply with U.S. Treasury sanctions and were executed in a coordinated manner.

articles.title: BNB slides to $900 as traders look to havens
articles.description: The token's price action shows signs of indecision, with a tight trading range and fading selling pressure.

articles.title: What is Crypto.com?
articles.description: Crypto.com is a popular centralized crypto exchange that is also tied to the multi-layer Cronos ecosystem and the CRO token.

articles.title: Quantum computing threatens the $2 trillion Bitcoin network. BTQ Technologies says it has a defense.
articles.description: Post-quantum cryptography specialist BTQ Technologies has introduced ‘Bitcoin Quantum,’ a permissionless fork and testnet of the largest cryptocurrency.

articles.title: Seventy economists urge EU to ‘let the public interest prevail’ on digital euro
articles.description: Economists urge EU lawmakers to back a public digital euro, warning that private stablecoins and foreign payment companies threaten Europe’s monetary sovereignty.

articles.title: Bitcoin fails haven test as Justice Dept. subpoenas Powell: Crypto Daybook Americas
articles.description: Your day-ahead look for Jan. 12, 2026

articles.title: Dubai free zone shifts crypto token vetting to licensed companies
articles.description: DFSA’s new company-led suitability model and AML expectations may make it difficult for licensed entities to justify supporting privacy-focused assets.

articles.title: Vitalik Buterin outlines conditions for a self-sustaining, quantum-safe Ethereum
articles.description: Buterin outlined a framework for making Ethereum’s base layer ossifiable, emphasizing quantum resistance and protocol independence.

articles.title: Bitcoin pares Powell-fueled spike as privacy coins outperform: Crypto Markets Today
articles.description: Bitcoin briefly topped $92,000 on interest-rate uncertainty, while privacy coins hit fresh highs and memecoin activity lifted select altcoins.

articles.title: Weekly crypto ETP outflows reach $454 million as hopes for Fed easing dim: CoinShares
articles.description: Global crypto asset funds saw $454 million in net outflows last week amid weakening rate-cut expectations, according to CoinShares.

articles.title: Trove Markets’ $11.5M token sale sparks backlash after last-minute changes spill into Polymarket bet
articles.description: Trove Markets’ token sale has drawn scrutiny after last-minute changes, mixed messaging, and alleged irregular trading.

articles.title: Bernstein says window for crypto market structure bill is ‘here and now,’ as concerns over stablecoin rewards remain key sticking point
articles.description: Bernstein said the window to pass the bill is rapidly narrowing amid a dispute between banks and the crypto industry over stablecoin rewards.

articles.title: Crypto funds bleed $454M in outflows as Fed rate-cut hopes fade
articles.description: Bitcoin led with $405 million of outflows last week, with the US shedding $569 million, as several altcoins and European funds posted modest inflows.

articles.title: UK lawmakers push to ban crypto political donations over foreign interference fears
articles.description: They argue that cryptocurrency's opacity and traceability issues make it a threat to democratic integrity, citing an intelligence report election interference.

articles.title: OKX founder defends asset freezes after user admits buying KYC accounts
articles.description: Star Xu defended freezing $40,000 in stablecoins after a user admitted buying verified accounts, with the exchange citing strict KYC and AML obligations.

articles.title: Powell investigation may introduce ‘risk premia’ for Bitcoin: Analysts
articles.description: Bitcoin’s non-sovereign narrative is gaining attention as reports of a probe into US Fed Chair Jerome Powell raise concerns over political pressure and markets.

articles.title: U.S. inflation report, BNB Smart Chain’s hard fork: Crypto Week Ahead
articles.description: Your look at what's coming in the week starting Jan. 12.

articles.title: Dubai bans privacy tokens, tightens stablecoin rules in crypto reset
articles.description: Dubai's financial regulator said privacy-focused assets are incompatible with global compliance norms as it moves to a firm-led token suitability model and sharper stablecoin classifications.

articles.title: Veteran trader Peter Brandt hints at silver-like bull run in Monero
articles.description: Monero set fresh records earlier Monday, driven by renewed interest in privacy and upcoming protocol upgrades.

articles.title: Coinbase pushes back against banks to keep rewarding users for holding stablecoins
articles.description: Disagreements over stablecoin rewards have frayed bipartisan support for the bill, with traders estimating a 68-70% chance of passage this year.

articles.title: Adam Back-backed Bitcoin treasury Future Holdings set for takeover by H100
articles.description: Adam Back-backed Bitcoin treasury Future Holdings has agreed to a takeover proposal from Sweden-listed H100 Group as it eyes expansion into Switzerland.

articles.title: Bitcoin treasury firms linked to Adam Back sign preliminary agreement to combine
articles.description: The proposed deal would take Sweden-based H100 into Switzerland and deepen its institutional bitcoin treasury strategy.

articles.title: Bitcoin's early gains fade fast as prices fall back below $91,000
articles.description: Risk sentiment deteriorates as safe havens outperform and equities weaken.

articles.title: Stablecoins, sanctions and surveillance: Why 2025 reshaped crypto’s regulatory reality
articles.description: From record onchain volumes to geopolitics-driven crypto crime, 2025 structurally shifted how regulators and institutions engaged with digital assets, with stablecoins at the center.

articles.title: Fed rate cuts under fire: 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
articles.description: Bitcoin injected volatility as legal action against the Federal Reserve combined with market nerves over geopolitics at the start of a key week for inflation data.

articles.title: SEC delays PENGU and T. Rowe crypto ETFs as Grayscale seeks options green light
articles.description: The SEC delayed decisions on two crypto ETFs and opened public comments on options tied to a Grayscale multi-asset crypto fund.

articles.title: Tether freezes $182 million in USDT tied to five Tron addresses
articles.description: Tether froze $182 million in USDT across five Tron wallets, highlighting enforcement as stablecoins dominate illicit crypto flows.

articles.title: South Korea proposes 5% limit for listed firms’ crypto exposure
articles.description: The proposed guidelines would allow eligible firms to invest in the top 20 cryptocurrencies by market value.

articles.title: Tether’s role in Venezuela, Iran highlights the duality of stablecoins
articles.description: The dual life of stablecoins: A lifeline for citizens and a tool for sanctioned entities involved in Venezuela and Iran's economic crises.

articles.title: Most US debanking cases stem from government pressure, report says
articles.description: Cato Institute analyst Nicholas Anthony argues the US Congress needs to reform the Bank Secrecy Act, repeal confidentiality laws and end reputational risk regulation to address debanking.

articles.title: India tightens crypto rules to fight money laundering and terror funding
articles.description: India's financial intelligence agency has announced stricter identity verification measures for cryptocurrency exchanges to prevent money laundering and terror financing.

articles.title: South Korea to lift ban on corporate crypto investment: Report
articles.description: South Korea’s FSC reportedly shared guidelines allowing listed companies to invest up to 5% of equity in the top 20 cryptocurrencies, ending a 2017 ban.

articles.title: Bitcoin, privacy coins rally as Trump-Powell conflict escalates
articles.description: The rally came shortly after Powell said that the DOJ had threatened him with criminal charges over his June 2025 congressional testimony.

articles.title: South Korean authorities seek 5% cap on corporate crypto investments: report
articles.description: South Korea's FSC is proposing a 5% cap on the share of a company's equity capital that can be allocated to digital asset investments.

articles.title: ​​Top UK Labour lawmakers push to ban political donations made in crypto
articles.description: The chairs of seven UK government committees have asked for a ban on crypto donations to be added to an elections bill set to be introduced soon.

articles.title: Bitcoin rises 1%, Nasdaq futures and dollar drop as Trump-Powell feud escalates
articles.description: Bitcoin's price movement diverged from the Nasdaq futures, which fell nearly 0.8%.

articles.title: Ethereum needs better decentralized stablecoins: Vitalik Buterin
articles.description: It isn’t a good idea to fully back a stablecoin with a single fiat currency, because if that nation-state fails, so will the stablecoin, argues Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin.

articles.title: Privacy tokens rally as XMR breaks all-time high
articles.description: XMR, ZEC, SOL and other alts are rallying as BTC remains rangebound

articles.title: Crypto YouTube views sink to lowest level since early 2021, ‘it’s not just X'
articles.description: Crypto content viewership on YouTube has plunged over the past three months, signaling bear market conditions as retail interest in crypto continues to decline.
